nodes.text: Isolate peripheral blood lymphocytes from different healthy donors using Ficoll gradients.
Isolate NK cells using the NK isolation kit II (Miltenyi Biotec)
Sort 100 X 10^6 cells enriched for CD56+CD3-NK cells from each donor

For each experimental with NK subsets, also perform mock isolation of pbNK cells as if they were dNK cells to rule out the possibility that differences between NK subsets was due to methodological differences in isolation procedures. Achieve this by subjecting isolated pbNK cells to the same isolation protocol used for the isolation of dNK cells
Wash cells in PBS supplemented with 2% FCS and incubate with mAb on ice for 30 min.
Cell sort and measure fluorescence on a MoFlo high performance cell sorter
Collect data from single cell events using a standard FACScaliburTM flow cytometer
Highly purify peripheral blood NK subsets to obtain 2 subsets: CD56dimCD16+CD3- NK (pbCD16+ NK) and CD56brightCD16-CD3- (pbCD16- NK)
Perform intracellular staining with a Cytoperm-Cytofix Intracellular Staining kit
